required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Randomized Controlled Trial Between Auto-titration and Manual Titration of Non-invasive Ventilation in Obesity Hypoventilation Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Noninvasive Ventilation Adjusted Automatically in the Obesity Hypoventilation Syndrome

lead_sponsor.agency: Sociedad Española de Neumología y Cirugía Torácica

clinical_study.source: Sociedad Española de Neumología y Cirugía Torácica

brief_summary.textblock: Primary Objectives: To evaluate the effectiveness in the obesity hypoventilation syndrome (OHS) treatment with non-invasive ventilation (NIV) set manually by polysomnography compared to the same treatment with a respirator with automatic NIV adjustment, analyzing as primary variable PaCO2 and as operational variables dropout rate for medical reasons and mortality. Secondary objectives: cost-effectiveness, clinical and functional improvement in wakefulness and during sleep, quality of life, blood pressure monitoring for 24 hours, incidence and evolution of cardiovascular events and use of health resources. Other objectives: 1) effectiveness of treatments in the following subgroups of patients: gender, age, socioeconomic status, severity of sleep apnea, VNI compliance, quality of life and comorbidities; 2) To evaluate the profile of patients with poor adherence to NIV based on clinical severity, gender, age and socioeconomic status in the whole sample and in both intervention groups.

detailed_description.textblock: Method: Prospective, blind researchers, randomized, controlled non-inferiority and cost-effectiveness relationship, with two parallel open groups. 200 OHS patients will be divided into two groups by simple randomization 1:1 and followed for one year. The premise of non-inferiority is -2 at the lower limit of the confidence interval 95% for the change in PCO2 between the arms being assessed by analysis of covariance, adjusted for 2-sided, age, sex, body mass index in intention-to-treat and per-protocol analysis. The cost-effectiveness will be performed by Bayesian techniques with sensitivity analysis.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Prospective, Randomized, double arm, double blind controlled trial.
study_design_info.masking_description: Two investigators (named Investigator 1 and Investigator 2) participate in each center, with different tasks. Investigator 1 is responsible of randomization and will be aware of the study group assigned to the patient. Investigator 2 will collect in each visit health resource utilization, specific and QoL tests and laboratory test results. Investigator 2 does not know the study arm. Patients will not be informed about the ventilator settings and the menu of the ventilator will be locked, so they cannot access to ventilator data.

primary_outcome.description: Arterial blood gases while room air breathing expressed in mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Cost-effectiveness analysis by primary outcome
secondary_outcome.description: Cost-effectiveness analysis based on the primary outcome in mmHg Differences in within trial costs will be related with the differences in effectiveness (primary outcome) between arms using a probabilistic Bayesian approach to calculate the cost-effectiveness plane.

secondary_outcome.measure: Cost-effectiveness analysis by QALY
secondary_outcome.description: Cost-effectiveness analysis based on the quality adjusted life year (QALY) Differences in within trial costs will be related with the differences in effectiveness (QALY) between arms using a probabilistic Bayesian approach to calculate the cost-effectiveness plane.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in subjective daytime sleepiness
secondary_outcome.description: Sleepiness evaluated by Epworth sleepiness scale, range from 0 to 24, being 0 the best result and 24 the worst.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of life measured by Functional Sleep Outcomes of Sleep Questionnaire (FOSQ)
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life measured by Functional Sleep Outcomes of Sleep Questionnaire (FOSQ), range from 0 to 120, being 0 the worst result and 120 the best result .

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of life measured by visual analogical wellbeing scale (VAWS)
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life measured by visual analogical well-being scale (VAWS), range from 0 to 100, being 0 the worst result and 120 the best result .

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of life measured by Euroqol 5D.
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life measured by Euroqol 5D, range from 0 to 1, being 0 the worst result and 1 the best result .

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of life measured by Short Form-36 (SF36), Mental component
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life measured by Short Form-36 (SF36) Mental component,range from 0 to 100, being 0 the worst result and 100 the best result.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Quality of life measured by Short Form-36 (SF36), Physical component
secondary_outcome.description: Quality of life measured by Short Form-36 (SF36) Physical component,range from 0 to 100, being 0 the worst result and 100 the best result.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Bicarbonate arterial blood concentration
secondary_outcome.description: Arterial blood gases while breathing room air expressed in mmol/L

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in PaO2
secondary_outcome.description: Arterial blood gases while breathing room air expressed PaO2 in mmHg

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in pH
secondary_outcome.description: Arterial blood gases while breathing room air

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in polysomnographic Sleep periods
secondary_outcome.description: Standard polysomnography. time of sleep periods (Stage 1,2,3,4 and REM) in minutes.

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Arousal Index
secondary_outcome.description: Standard polysomnography, number of arousals per sleep hour

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Apnea-Hypopnea index
secondary_outcome.description: Standard polysomnography, number of apneas and hypoapneas per sleep hour

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Oxygen desaturation index
secondary_outcome.description: Standard polysomnography, number of 3% or more Oxygen desaturations per sleep hour

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Sleep time with Oxygen saturation below 90%
secondary_outcome.description: Standard polysomnography, percentage of sleep time with oxygen saturation below 90%

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in polysomnographic parameters: Total Sleep time (TTS)
secondary_outcome.description: Standard polysomnography, time in minutes

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in the blood pressure monitoring
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at baseline and after a year
secondary_outcome.description: The blood pressure will be monitored during 24 hours with a Blood Pressure Monitoring device before (baseline) and after intervention (1 year) in both arms measured in mmHg. Change in the mean blood pressure will be compared between arms

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidental cardiovascular events
secondary_outcome.description: New hypertension diagnosis or anti-hypertensive treatment, atrial fibrillation, hospitalization for nonfatal myocardial infarction or instable angina, nonfatal stroke or transient ischemic attack or for heart failure episode, and cardiovascular death. Data obtained from official electronic health care databases

secondary_outcome.measure: Health care resources utilization: Hospital admission
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital admission measured in number of events

secondary_outcome.measure: Health care resources utilization: Hospital duration
secondary_outcome.description: Hospital duration measured in days of hospitalization

secondary_outcome.measure: Health care resources utilization: ICU admission
secondary_outcome.description: ICU admission measured in numbers of events

secondary_outcome.measure: Health care resources utilization: ICU duration
secondary_outcome.description: ICU duration measured in days of UCI admissions

secondary_outcome.measure: Health care resources utilization: emergency visits
secondary_outcome.description: Emergency visits measured in number of events

secondary_outcome.measure: Health care resources utilization: primary care visits
secondary_outcome.description: Primary care visits measured in number of events

secondary_outcome.measure: Health care resources utilization: specialist visits
secondary_outcome.description: Specialist visits measured in number of events

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence of new adverse event
secondary_outcome.description: Number of adverse events based in CTCAE v4.0

secondary_outcome.measure: Side effects
secondary_outcome.description: Incidence or side effects of NIV in follow-up visits: excessive noise, headache, claustrophobia, difficulty in sleep conciliation or maintenance, expiration discomfort.

other_outcome.measure: Adherent vs. non-adherent to noninvasive ventilation therapy subgroups
other_outcome.description: Efficacy between arms measuring Epworth sleepiness scale (from 0 to 24 points) comparing adherent vs. non-adherent to non-invasive ventilation therapy subgroups (higher and lower of 4 hours per day)

Efficacy between arms measuring Epworth sleepiness scale (from 0 to 24 points) comparing sleep apnea severity subgroups measured by apnea and hypopnea index at baseline (higher and lower of the median)
Efficacy between arms measuring Epworth sleepiness scale (from 0 to 24 points) comparing hypercapnia severity subgroups measured by PaCO2 (mmHg) at baseline (higher and lower of the median)
Efficacy between arms measuring Epworth sleepiness scale (from 0 to 24 points) comparing the presence of hypertension diagnosis subgroups at baseline

Efficacy between arms measuring Epworth sleepiness scale (from 0 to 24 points) comparing the resolution of hypercapnia measured by PaCO2 (mmHg) at the end of the follow-up (higher and lower of 45 mmHg)

arm_group.description: In this group non invasive mechanical ventilation will be manually titrated during a polysomnography. The Philips A40 ventilator will be used in Spontaneous-Timed (ST) mode.
In this group the ventilator will run in an automatic mode (AVAPS) with the same Phillips A40 ventilator.

intervention.description: Manual Group: during a complete polysomnography, adding transcutaneous capnography and the basic ventilators curves, the ventilators setting will be adjusted in order to correct respiratory events and patient-ventilator asyncrony. A 10 hours face-to-face investigator training meeting is programmed before opening the inclusion period.
Automatic Group: the A40 ventilator in the automatic AVAPS mode will be adjusted in order to achieve 8-10 ml/kg of ideal weight.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. Obesity Hypoventilation Syndrome defined by obesity (IMC≥30) and Hypercapnic respiratory failure (PCO 2> 45 mm Hg) in stable phase (PH≥7.35 without clinical signs of worsening in at least one previous month).
2. Age between 18-80 years.
3. Absence of other diseases causing hypercapnia as moderate or severe chronic obstructive pulmonary disease (FEV1> 70% predicted if FEV1 / FVC <70), neuromuscular, thoracic wall or metabolic disease; d) Absence of narcolepsy or restless legs syndrome.
4. Overcome correctly a 30 minutes test of treatment with VNI in wakefulness.
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Psychophysical disability for questionnaires.
2. Patients who cannot be evaluated by quality of life questionnaires because they present debilitating chronic disease.
3. Chronic nasal obstruction that prevents the use of NIV.
4. Pregnancy.
5. No informed consent obtained.
